Now, the C code structure:

#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

int main() {
    int n;
    scanf("%d", &n);
    int arr[n];
    for (int i =0; i <n; i++) {
        scanf("%d", &arr[i]);
    }

    // Compute ans array
    int ans[n];
    int mx = arr[n-1];
    for (int i = n-2; i >=0; i--) {
        ans[i] = (mx - arr[i] +1 >0) ? (mx - arr[i] +1) : 0;
        if (arr[i] > mx) {
            mx = arr[i];
        }
    }

    // Create the string for second part
    // Compute length
    int len =0;
    for (int i=0; i <n; i++) {
        len += snprintf(NULL, 0, "%d", ans[i]) +1; // +1 for space
    }
    len -=1; // remove last space
    char *s = (char*)malloc(len+1);
    s[0] = '\0';
    for (int i=0; i <n; i++) {
        char temp[20];
        sprintf(temp, "%d", ans[i]);
        strcat(s, temp);
        if (i !=n-1) {
            strcat(s, " ");
        }
    }

    // Process second part
    int num_g =0, num_p=0;
    int score =0;
    for (int i=0; s[i] != '\0'; i++) {
        char x = s[i];
        if (x == 'g') {
            if (num_g - num_p >0) {
                score +=1;
                num_p +=1;
            } else {
                num_g +=1;
            }
        } else if (x == 'p') {
            if (num_g - num_p >0) {
                num_p +=1;
            } else {
                score -=1;
                num_g +=1;
            }
        }
    }
    free(s);

    // Process third part
    int k = score;
    int t =0;
    int found =0;
    for (int i=1; i <=k; i++) {
        t = (t %k) *10 +7;
        if (t %k ==0) {
            printf("%d\n", i);
            found =1;
            break;
        }
    }
    if (!found) {
        printf("-1\n");
    }

    return 0;
}
